summary: This is a transcript of a sworn interview conducted by the DOJ Office of the Inspector General with the Warden of the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York on August 12, 2019, regarding the circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death. The Warden discusses Epstein's arrival, housing, suicide attempt on July 23, 2019, placement on and off suicide watch, cellmate assignments, staffing issues, and the events leading up to his death on August 10, 2019.

connections.description: The Warden was responsible for Epstein's custody and housing at MCC. He had brief interactions with Epstein and was briefed on his status.
Epstein was initially housed with inmate Tartaglione in the SHU. Tartaglione was present during the July 23 incident investigated as a possible suicide attempt.
Reyes was selected to be Epstein's cellmate after he was moved off suicide watch. Reyes was discharged on August 9, leaving Epstein alone in his cell.
The Warden gave direct orders to the Captain that Epstein was to have a cellmate at all times and that this instruction was to be disseminated to SHU staff.
The Warden relied on the Chief Psychologist's professional judgment regarding Epstein's mental health status and removal from suicide watch. They discussed Epstein in weekly SHU meetings.
Dr. and her psychology staff were responsible for evaluating Epstein's mental health, placing him on and off suicide watch, and developing treatment plans.

events.title: Epstein's First Suicide Attempt/Incident
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found injured in his cell with cellmate Tartaglione. An internal investigation was conducted. Epstein denied a suicide attempt; Tartaglione thought he was having a heart attack. Epstein was placed on suicide watch following this incident.

events.title: Epstein Moved from Suicide Watch to Psyche Observation
events.description: Epstein was downgraded from suicide watch to psychological observation, still on the second-floor medical unit. The Chief Psychologist determined he was no longer suicidal.

events.title: Epstein Returned to SHU with Cellmate
events.description: Epstein was moved from psyche observation back to the Special Housing Unit. The Warden selected inmate Reyes as his new cellmate after vetting options with higher-ups.

events.title: Cellmate Reyes Discharged from MCC
events.description: Inmate Reyes was discharged from MCC 'with all belongings,' leaving Jeffrey Epstein without a cellmate. Staff failed to replace him or notify supervisors as required.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell in the SHU at approximately 6:50 AM. Life-saving measures were performed, and he was pronounced dead at an outside hospital. The incident was ruled a suicide.

events.title: OIG Interview with MCC Warden
events.description: The Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General conducted a sworn interview with the Warden of MCC to investigate the circumstances of Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death.

locations: Second-floor medical/suicide watch unit at MCC
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein arrived at MCC unexpectedly on a weekend without prior notification to the Warden. He was initially placed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) due to his high-profile status.

The Warden received a direct order from his Regional Director to keep Epstein in the SHU and not place him in general population. The Warden then instructed his staff that Epstein was to have a cellmate at all times.
Epstein's cellmate, Reyes, was discharged from MCC on August 9, 2019. Staff in the SHU failed to replace him or notify supervisors that Epstein was alone, contrary to specific orders.
The Warden stated the camera system in the MCC was unreliable and outdated. The SIS Lieutenant had reported problems with the SHU cameras prior to Epstein's death.
The institution was understaffed (approx. 80%), leading to extensive overtime. Staff from other departments (like material handlers) were working overtime shifts as correctional officers in the SHU.
